```{r}

# CHANGE THIS to match the data path on your computer
getwd()
datadir <- "MSK_Dashboard/Data/"

# Load the data
clin_patient <- fread(paste0(datadir, "data_clinical_patient.txt"), skip = 4)
clin_sample  <- fread(paste0(datadir, "data_clinical_sample.txt"), skip = 4)
muta <- fread(paste0(datadir, "data_mutations.txt"))
cna  <- fread(paste0(datadir, "data_cna.txt"))
sv   <- fread(paste0(datadir, "data_sv.txt"))

str(clin_patient)
str(clin_sample)
str(muta)
str(cna)
str(sv)
head(clin_patient)
colnames(clin_patient)

# Ensure survival variable
clin_patient$OS_STATUS_BIN <- ifelse(grepl("DECEASED", clin_patient$OS_STATUS), 1, 0)
clin_patient <- as.data.table(clin_patient)
clin_patient <- as.data.table(clin_patient)

# Merge by PATIENT_ID
merged_data <- merge(clin_sample, clin_patient, by = "PATIENT_ID", all.x = TRUE)
head(merged_data)

library(dplyr)

merged_data %>%
  group_by(CANCER_TYPE, OS_STATUS_BIN) %>%
  summarise(n = n()) %>%
  arrange(CANCER_TYPE)


# Subset correctly
bc <- merged_data[merged_data$CANCER_TYPE == "Breast Cancer", ]

# Fit survival curve
fit <- survfit(Surv(OS_MONTHS, OS_STATUS_BIN) ~ 1, data = bc)

# Plot
ggsurvplot(fit,
           risk.table = TRUE,
           conf.int = TRUE,
           xlab = "Months",
           ylab = "Survival Probability",
           title = "Overall Survival for Breast Cancer")

```

# Example: mutation count per cancer type
```{r}

muta_with_patient <- merge(
    muta,
    clin_sample[, .(SAMPLE_ID, PATIENT_ID, CANCER_TYPE)],
    by.x = "Tumor_Sample_Barcode",
    by.y = "SAMPLE_ID",
    all.x = TRUE
  )

forplot <- muta_with_patient[, .N, by = .(Hugo_Symbol, CANCER_TYPE)]
ggplot(forplot, aes(x = CANCER_TYPE, y = N)) +
  geom_boxplot(outliers = FALSE) +
  coord_flip()
```
